verses.text: Fret not thyself because of evildoers , neither be thou envious against the workers of iniquity. \q1
For they shall soon be cut down like the grass , and wither as the green herb. \q1
Trust in the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*, and do good ; \add so\add* shalt thou dwell in the land , and verily thou shalt be fed.\f + \fr 37.3 \ft verily: Heb. in truth, or, stableness\f* \q1
Delight thyself also in the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*; and he shall give thee the desires of thine heart. \q1
Commit thy way unto the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*; trust also in him; and he shall bring \add it\add* to pass.\f + \fr 37.5 \ft Commit…: Heb. Roll thy way upon\f* \q1
And he shall bring forth thy righteousness as the light , and thy judgment as the noonday. \b \q1

Rest in the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*, and wait patiently for him: fret not thyself because of him who prospereth in his way , because of the man who bringeth wicked devices to pass.\f + \fr 37.7 \ft Rest in: Heb. Be silent to\f* \q1
Cease from anger , and forsake wrath : fret not thyself in any wise to do evil. \q1
For evildoers shall be cut off : but those that wait upon the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*, they shall inherit the earth. \q1
For yet a little while , and the wicked \add shall\add* not \add be:\add* yea, thou shalt diligently consider his place , and it \add shall\add* not \add be\add*. \q1
But the meek shall inherit the earth ; and shall delight themselves in the abundance of peace. \q1
The wicked plotteth against the just , and gnasheth upon him with his teeth.\f + \fr 37.12 \ft plotteth: or, practiseth\f* \q1
The Lord shall laugh at him: for he seeth that his day is coming. \q1

The wicked have drawn out the sword , and have bent their bow , to cast down the poor and needy , \add and\add* to slay such as be of upright conversation.\f + \fr 37.14 \ft such…: Heb. the upright of way\f* \q1
Their sword shall enter into their own heart , and their bows shall be broken. \q1
A little that a righteous man hath \add is\add* better than the riches of many wicked. \q1
For the arms of the wicked shall be broken : but the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* upholdeth the righteous. \q1
The \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* knoweth the days of the upright : and their inheritance shall be for ever. \q1
They shall not be ashamed in the evil time : and in the days of famine they shall be satisfied. \q1

But the wicked shall perish , and the enemies of the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* \add shall be\add* as the fat of lambs : they shall consume ; into smoke shall they consume away.\f + \fr 37.20 \ft the fat: Heb. the preciousness\f* \b \q1
The wicked borroweth , and payeth not again : but the righteous sheweth mercy , and giveth. \q1
For \add such as be\add* blessed of him shall inherit the earth ; and \add they that be\add* cursed of him shall be cut off. \q1
The steps of a \add good\add* man are ordered by the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*: and he delighteth in his way.\f + \fr 37.23 \ft ordered: or, established\f* \q1
Though he fall , he shall not be utterly cast down : for the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* upholdeth \add him with\add* his hand. \q1
I have been young , and \add now\add* am old ; yet have I not seen the righteous forsaken , nor his seed begging bread. \q1
\add He is\add* ever merciful , and lendeth ; and his seed \add is\add* blessed.\f + \fr 37.26 \ft ever: Heb. all the day\f* \q1
Depart from evil , and do good ; and dwell for evermore. \q1
For the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* loveth judgment , and forsaketh not his saints ; they are preserved for ever : but the seed of the wicked shall be cut off. \q1
The righteous shall inherit the land , and dwell therein for ever. \q1
The mouth of the righteous speaketh wisdom , and his tongue talketh of judgment. \q1
The law of his God \add is\add* in his heart ; none of his steps shall slide.\f + \fr 37.31 \ft steps: or, goings\f* \q1
The wicked watcheth the righteous , and seeketh to slay him. \q1
The \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* will not leave him in his hand , nor condemn him when he is judged. \b \q1
Wait on the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*, and keep his way , and he shall exalt thee to inherit the land : when the wicked are cut off , thou shalt see \add it\add*. \q1
I have seen the wicked in great power , and spreading himself like a green bay tree.\f + \fr 37.35 \ft a green…: or, a green tree that groweth in his own soil\f* \q1
Yet he passed away , and, lo, he \add was\add* not: yea, I sought him, but he could not be found. \q1
Mark the perfect \add man\add*, and behold the upright : for the end of \add that\add* man \add is\add* peace. \q1
But the transgressors shall be destroyed together : the end of the wicked shall be cut off. \q1
But the salvation of the righteous \add is\add* of the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*: \add he is\add* their strength in the time of trouble. \q1
And the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* shall help them, and deliver them: he shall deliver them from the wicked , and save them, because they trust in him.
